q: January 28, 2011 at 11:00 am. His daughter Mia Tyler seems to think so. The front man's doting daughter made some comments about her dad outshining the other judges. He's the funniest man I know. He's saving the show because it was kind of boring before. There's only so many times you can watch Simon Cowell be mean to people, she said. Steven Tyler is no Simon Cowell but he definitely has had some of his "mean moments." As far as him saving the show, I don't know about that just yet.

the spirit of America's transition from a rural society to an industrial one. He ran his studio like a factory, stocked with large amounts of raw material. On steel as a medium, he said: What it can do in arriving at form economically, no other material can do. The metal itself possesses little art history. What associations it possesses are those of this century: power, structure, movement, progress, suspension, destruction and brutality. to take his British programme The X Factor to America this year, and speculation is rife over who will judge it. Jane Lynch insists the rumours can now end, as she has the perfect solution. People have asked me, "What about having Sue on The X Factor? How would she do?' I think she'd be fantastic- and there would be a few contestants reduced to tears, she laughed. "It can never happen, though. Simon Cowell and Sue on the same judging panel will never work in a million years- there"s only room for one ego on the show!

less interested in any reconnection with Jay Leno . His relationship with David Letterman remains unaffected- his Late Night predecessor apparently called him over the holidays. "It was just a quick call," Conan O'Brien qualifies. We hadn't spoken for a long time, and David Letterman just called to basically say, you know,' I haven't checked in on you. I just wanted to make sure that we were good.' And I said, "We've always been good.' I have a lot of respect for that guy. It was not a lengthy phone call. He's not a blabbermouth, but it was nice. It was just nice to get the call. A reconciliation with Jay Leno , though, seems highly unlikely. "I don't think so," Conan O'Brien concedes. "I mean, I think we all know what... you know. There"s
